item.description:
This month's PHOENIX ART AFTER HOURS looks pretty good.

Sponsored by The Phoenix Companies, Inc.
Rise Up Remix Block Party is August 5, 5:00-9:00 pm


$5 / Free for Phoenix Employees, Museum Members.

Phoenix Art After Hours provides a stimulating setting for mingling with friends after work. Sip a cocktail, enjoy music and other live performances, attend a gallery talk, and even see a classic movie or art film. The Wadsworth Atheneum is open until 8 pm the first Thursday of every month.

RISE UP REMIX
The museum joins forces with The Amistad Center for Art & Culture, Taste of the Caribbean and Jerk Festival, West Indian Social Club and Young! Studios to celebrate all things Caribbean on the Travelers Plaza

REGGAE
Special guest Turbulence, featured in Rise Up, performs his hit song Notorious, and is joined by other local talent

BEATS AND BRIDGES
An exhibition of photographs illustrating the power of music created by students from The Amistad Center’s Neighborhood Studios

REFRESHMENTS
Receive a taste of Ten Penny Ale from Olde Burnside Brewing Co. (free while supplies last), enjoy a Rum Punch (for the first 100 guests), and sample food ($$) provided by Hartford area Caribbean restaurants.

FILM 8 PM- RISE UP
Back by popular demand! A film that depicts an uplifting journey into the heart of Jamaica—the island that gave birth to the worldwide cultural phenomenon of Reggae. In a society where talent abounds and opportunity is scarce, three distinct artists fight to rise up from obscurity.


GALLERIES and THE MUSEUM SHOP OPEN TILL 8
Convenient parking available at the Front Street Garage, off Prospect Street, behind the museum.

Parking is $7 max for the evening (includes the film) or $3 for the first hour, $2 for each hour after

Movie-
Rise Up is an uplifting journey into the heart of Jamaica—the island that gave birth to the worldwide cultural phenomenon of Reggae. In a society where talent abounds and opportunity is scarce, three distinct artists fight to rise up from obscurity.
item.name: Wadsworth First Thursday
